description: This hike is 15km, with an 800m elevation gain.  Nice views of the Rockies to the West, and the Pine Pass to the East.  The best way to get to the top is to follow the skid road 1.4 km along the power lines till you come to the cutblock on the right, then take a bearing on the fire lookout, and go through the cutblock and about 2km of forest, then another 1.5km through sub alpine scrub to the base of the mountain, then ascend the steep trail up to the fire lookout, and follow the ridge North to the summit.
directions: Mt. Bickford is accessed via Hwy 97, and is approximately 270 km north of Prince George, or,  heading South, 61km south of Chetwynd.  The GPS coordinates for the easily missed left turn (heading from PG) onto the Fischer  forestry road are: N 55 35.986 W 122 19.687 .  The parking area is 6km in ( N55 36.7456 W 122 21.9098), and the trail head is the skid road branching left.
title: Mt. Bickford
